Topic.Title: I covered my short in goog friday in afternoon...

Message.Msg: Tough call....this market is pretty bizarre so nothing would surprise me....GOOG could end up opening 12-15 points higher...if it does then you have your re-entry..... However, there is a decent chance to pull back to 770's Monday morning at the opening.... but could rebound if the market is positive late Monday or Tuesday....don't ask me why....just guessing here.... If the overall market rolls over Monday and Tuesday...then GOOG will most likely see 740-750 range in that time-frame....I own 9 PUT contracts NTM...so I stand to gain significantly in this scenario... Who knows....I don't think many stocks would react positively to an insider selling 42% while nearing or at an ATH.....so I could get lucky here.... We'll see

Message.Title: GOOG gap down for sur ebut will close at all time high at close!
Message.Msg: A Non CEO or CFO insider sale is never a big concern for companies like GOOG. Who wants a bet?

Topic.Title: I covered my short in goog friday in afternoon...

Message.Msg: Expected 66% fib. retracement move from previous run-up starting at 667 to 785 now, is around 708... it will get there fast now, with all this mega-dump news from the prime-insider. Who wants to stretch out his hands, catch the falling dumps and later on stink-up one's portfolio unnecessarily? LoL! :-)

Message.Title: DOW S&P NASDAQ RUSSELL ALL TIME HIGH MARKET GOING HUGE SELL OFF ANY TIME
Message.Msg: Just trade very cautios. Market will tank any time. short term GOOG go to $700 range.
The first line of defense is around the 20 day moving average @ $750, then 50 day moving average $725-735 in 2 weeks.

The caveat to a possible Monday sell off is the total shares traded during the day Friday. If the total shares traded was less then normal I'd be very concerned But it was 700k above normal. I would think that the big investment groups would not be so stupid as not to know the Nov. filing for the sale of 41 % of GOOG thru the end of 2013 and wouldn't have bought on Friday. If they didn't and were caught flatfooted, shame on them. IMHO I don't think it will be a sell off of any magnitude on Monday. I can accept a $10-20 drop. I can also assume that this (sell off event) may be a could respit to the great moves for the last few weeks in GOOG. WE WILL SEE!
edgar,rosen Both good estimates

Action on Friday was due to the Merrill pump Sucked in a lot of retail I don't buy the suggestion that everybody knew about the 42% before it was announced That's a pretty big deal But you're right....we'll see

Topic.Title: GOOG gap down for sur ebut will close at all time high at close!

Message.Msg: Bet is already in...but it wasn't because of an insider sale GOOG is due to pull back a little before going higher Insider sale was a catalyst and could impact market sentiment...that's all

In all due respect, the Merrill upgrade would not have suckered in the smartest guys on the street. If so, they should all be fired for their lack of DD. And unfortunately the retail investors will take it in the shorts (pants that is). Hopeing for the best on Monday for no major selloff.

"Nov. filing for the sale of 41 % of GOOG" Please note: this was "planned", not "filed" in November. The filing was done on Friday, so before Friday it was not public information. If you are suggesting that "the big investment groups" should have had known about this plan,... well.. legally they couldn't. Illigally?...every thing is possible..

Topic.Title: I covered my short in goog friday in afternoon...

Message.Msg: Monday might go down...but I am not sure of rest of the week...staying on sidelines for a day or two is not bad idea

If I'm not mistaken the filing with the sec was in November. Yes I agree the anouncement was made to the public after hours on Friday because it was a done deal. I can't understand when something of this magnitude is not public information prior to the Friday announcement. If you dig far enough into this info you should have uncovered the projected sales by the insider. If that is not the case the SEC is once again screwing the retail investors. This info should have been made public in Nov.

I agree. Loaded up on Friday with Feb 22 780 Puts. Despite overzealous GOOG Bulls a 42% sale by a CEO in his 50's, even if it is over a year is very frightening to the psychology of the market (basically questioning if we are at the top and the music is about to stop, even if it isn't true). Profit On!! RSTWIN

Really envy Eric S. and his billions. GOOG is quite overvalued at current prices given its 5-year 13% growth rate. Fair value at best is $710 although I held until $768 and latest $783. Thanks GOOG and see you back at $710.
